treatment.description: Plants annual or biennial, gla-brous, glaucous. Stems 5–50 cm. Leaves mostly alternate; blade lance-oblong to linear-oblance-olate, 5–30 mm, base narrowed to obscure petiole. Pedicels artic-ulated, to 1 mm. Flowers: sepals 1–1.5 mm; staminodes white to pink, sometimes red-tipped. Utricles 1–2 mm. 2n = 16, 18, 32, 54 (Europe).
treatment.discussion: Historical records from ballast grounds at Camden, New Jersey (1870s), and Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, exist, as well as a single report as a garden weed from Massachusetts (1900?; Manning s.n., GH).
